result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:06 AM Defendant David Charles Gold in court.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for David Charles Gold.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. 
Attny Pollak acknowledges information, waives reading.  Court enters NG plea on all counts.  Court finds probable cause and binds DEF over for trial.  Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.
Status conference scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on January 17, 2023 at 10:00 am.

CBS  $10,000  (Posted 8/18/2022)  No contact with any juveniles under the age of 18.    Except for purposes of employment at Lynn's Custom Meats,  DEF must be present while working with other adult employees.    No possession of electronic devices for purpose of accessing the internet.

CBS  $10,000  (Posted 8/18/2022)  No contact with any juveniles under the age of 18.    Except for purposes of employment at Lynn's Custom Meats,  DEF must be present while working with other adult employees.    No possession of electronic devices for purpose of accessing the internet.

9:54 AM Defendant David Charles Gold in court.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for David Charles Gold.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.   Attny Pollak indicates to proceed with preliminary hearing.    State calls witness, LCO Officer Zachary Zaug, sworn in by court.   State begins examination.  10:04 AM  Witness identified the DEF, court indicates the record will reflect.  State continues examination.  10:07 AM  Cross-Examination by Attorney Pollak.   Attny Pollak no further questions.  10:11 AM  Witness excused.   No further witness by either party.   State request for bind over.  Attny Pollak moves to dismiss, and makes argument.  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  

Attny Pollak filed a bond modification.   Court modifies bond conditions:   CBS  $10,000  (Posted 8/18/2022)  No contact with any juveniles under the age of 18.    Except for purposes of employment at Lynn's Custom Meats,  DEF must be present while working with other adult employees.    No possession of electronic devices for purpose of accessing the internet.
Arraignment scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Through Attorney, DEF waives time limits for preliminary hearing, but to set preliminary hearing.  Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.   Bond Continues.

11:13 AM DE David Gold court, appearing in custody by video from the Sawyer County Jail, with Atty Alysja Otten (special appearance). Bruce R Poquette appeared in person for the State of WI.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  DE verifies DOB and Address.  DE does qualify for public defender.  Court finds probable cause.  State makes bond recommendation.  Atty Otten argues bond. Court addresses the courtroom of any victims. Court takes no comments from the gallery as they are not victim-related. Court sets bond.
